alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 2:55AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 330 AM MDT... At 252 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles east of Wild Horse Point, or 42 miles north of North La Junta, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over rural areas of extreme southwestern Cheyenne County, Colorado. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM MDT.
